item.title: Tracking and Personalizing Connections – Chris Woody Woodruff
item.description: In the world of socket programming, managing client sessions is where the magic happens. It’s what transforms a basic connection into a personalized, memorable experience. Whether you’re building a chat application, a multiplayer game, or a real-time dashboard, tracking and managing client sessions is the secret sauce that keeps users engaged and coming back for more.

item.title: The Simplest Way To Deploy Your Containerized .NET Applications on Azure
item.description:
Hi, I'm James Eastham In this video, you'll learn the simplest way to run modern, scalable containerized .NET applications on Azure using Azure Container Apps.
We'll cover packaging your .NET application into a container, utilizing infrastructure as code with Pulumi, and easily setting up scalable environments. Say goodbye to worrying about Kubernetes and hello to a streamlined, fully repeatable deployment process.
00:00 Setting the Scene: Building Your First Backend 00:52 Introduction to Running Containerized .NET Apps on Azure 01:17 Understanding Azure Container Apps 02:06 Configuring Azure Container Apps 04:42 Deploying with Infrastructure as Code 05:23 Defining and Running Your Application with Pulumi 11:23 Final Thoughts and Next Steps
GitHub Repo - https://github.com/jeastham1993/PlantBasedPizza/tree/microservices-module-1
item.author: (James Eastham)

item.title: How Dennard Scaling Allowed Transistors to Shrink
item.description: A detailed explanation of Robert Dennard's exact rules to scale a MOS-transistor's dimensions that resulted in more transistors on a single chip without any thermal penalty.

item.title: Efficient LLM Scheduling by Learning to Rank
item.description: TL;DR: Traditional Large Language Model (LLM) serving systems rely on first-come-first-serve (FCFS) scheduling. When longer requests block shorter ones in the queue, this creates a cascade of delays that severely impacts overall system latency. LLM inference jobs are particularly challenging to schedule due to their highly unpredictable workload and variable output lengths. We developed a novel learning to rank approach that predicts the relative ranking of output lengths, enabling a more efficient Shortest Job First-like scheduling policy.

item.description: I haven't written about refactoring in a while.
